meanings.definition: The quality of being strikingly bold or showy in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her flamboyance in dressing always turned heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The actor's flamboyance on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: His flamboyance in wearing mismatched socks made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The garden's flamboyance of colors resembled a vibrant painting.
meanings.sent5: The peacock's flamboyance of feathers was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A tendency to attract attention because of one's exuberance, confidence, or stylishness.
meanings.sent1: The singer's flamboyance on stage made the crowd cheer louder.
meanings.sent2: Her flamboyance in social settings made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: His flamboyance in telling jokes always brought smiles to people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The city's flamboyance in architecture was a testament to its creativity.
meanings.sent5: The peacock's flamboyance of colors dazzled all who saw it.
